channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Burnt bin and contents, 19th October
item.description:
A bin on Rotherhithe street (close to doubletree docklands) has been burnt! A resident reported on a local fb group that a group of kids were trying to set something else on fire in the neighbourhood. I woke up to find the bin burnt on my street.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rotherhithe Street, Rotherhithe, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Litter in Alleyway, 19th October
item.description:
Lots of litter, cans etc in Alleyway between Stoke Newington Church Street and Oldfield Road / Painsthorpe Road. Reported earlier this week. Received an e mail on Saturday to say problem had been resolved. This is not the case as the litter is still there.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Stoke Newington Church Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: In Southend Rd Beckenham on the corner of Stumps Hill Lane is an empty site enclosed with c. 2.5m high green wooden hoardings. The panels are leaning over the public footway, appearing to be in danger of falling onto unsuspecting pedestrians, perhaps because fence stakes have broken., 18th October
item.description:
In Southend Rd Beckenham on the corner of Stumps Hill Lane is an empty site enclosed with c. 2.5m high green wooden hoardings. The panels are leaning over the public footway, appearing to be in danger of falling onto unsuspecting pedestrians, perhaps because fence stakes have broken. Please take enforcement action against the land owner to repair the hazardous leaning heavy panels.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southend Road, New Beckenham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Insistent dog barking and attack on a passer by, 18th October
item.description:
We are experiencing persistent dog barking as residents of the neighbouring community near Palace Close, being woken up late at night. C. 22:20, the small dog (chihuahua) was roaming on Chapman Road no leash and yelped on the road and nearly bit a passerby
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Palace Close, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Gang of motorbikes revving engines, 18th October
item.description:
The same gang of bikers return to frith street by bar Italia normally on the Friday night and Saturday night, revving their engines for long periods of time, creating a horrible noise that is experienced by every shop on Frith Street and Old Compton Steet. We have been reporting this for months, when calling 101 they claim they do not have enough people to deal with them, which is to be honest is not helpful to hear and quite puzzling. Bar Italia, also have issue with them and do not want their service. Additionally, the fumes go into our office at the theatre, which has given myself and the staff headaches from the prolonged exposure. It also, goes into our main foyer effecting the 1,700 audience members we cater to. Our cast and crew constantly complain about the noise and are fearful of leaving the building at points due to the large gang of bikers. They obstruct the pavement and the road on Frith Steet making it dangerous for pedestrians to get by, as cars could still hit them.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Frith Street, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, litter detritus, rats, 18th October

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 100, Martin's Road, Shortlands, London

item.title: Human faeces and drug use on shared alleyway, 18th October
item.description:
On the alleyway off Powerscroft Rd leading to 63-76 Lower Clapton Road, people have been leaving human faeces and taking drugs. We all, including kids, have to use this alleyway daily to get out of our flats. The poo smell is so strong and a health hazard.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Lower Clapton Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
